title:
Counting pairs of cycles whose product is a permutation with restricted
  cycle lengths
abstract:
We find exact and asymptotic formulas for the number of pairs $(p,q)$ of
$N$-cycles such that the all cycles of the product $p\cdot q$ have lengths from
a given integer set. We then apply these results to prove a surprisingly high
lower bound for the number of permutations whose block transposition distance
from the identity is at least $(n+1)/2$.
